pullRequest.body:
Introduces a natural pro-finite topology on the fundamental group of a fiber functor.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.Order.Category.FinBoolAlg` `Mathlib.Order.Category.NonemptyFinLinOrd` `Mathlib.Order.Category.FinBddDistLat` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.FintypeCat`</details>|2|

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ autEmbedding`
`+ autEmbedding_apply`
`+ autEmbedding_closedEmbedding`
`+ autEmbedding_injective`
`+ autEmbedding_range`
`+ autEmbedding_range_isClosed`
`+ aut_discreteTopology`
`+ foo`
`+ instance (X : C) : ContinuousSMul (Aut (F.obj X)) (F.obj X) := by`
`+ instance (X : C) : SMul (Aut (F.obj X)) (F.obj X) := ⟨fun σ a => σ.hom a⟩`
`+ instance (X : FintypeCat) : Finite (Aut X)`
`+ instance (X Y : FintypeCat) : Finite (X ≅ Y)`
`+ instance : CompactSpace (Aut F) := ClosedEmbedding.compactSpace (autEmbedding_closedEmbedding F)`
`+ instance : ContinuousInv (Aut F)`
`+ instance : ContinuousMul (Aut F)`
`+ instance : T2Space (Aut F)`
`+ instance : TopologicalGroup (Aut F) := ⟨⟩`
`+ instance : TopologicalSpace (Aut F)`
`+ instance : TotallyDisconnectedSpace (Aut F)`
`+ obj_discreteTopology`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10787823012/job/29917280982)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10787823012/job/29917281737)
Should not these be local/scoped instances?

Good idea, changed it. I left the other instances as is, since they are rather specific to the situation. The topology on `Aut F` should be the canonical one, but please say so if I should scope these as well.

Untested, but this should work:
```suggestion
    use NatIso.ofComponents (fun X => a X)
```
These two instances should be stated more generally for general objects in `FintypeCat` (and moved to a suitable file).

I am not very much expert in the mathlib implementation of topology, but I would suggest using a slightly different skeleton of proof:
```lean
lemma autEmbedding_range :
    Set.range (autEmbedding F) =
      ⋂ (f : Arrow C), { a | F.map f.hom ≫ (a f.right).hom = (a f.left).hom ≫ F.map f.hom } := by
  sorry

-- to be moved
lemma isClosed_equalizer {X Y : Type*}  [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] (f g : X → Y)
    (hf : Continuous f) (hg : Continuous g) [T2Space Y]:
    IsClosed { x : X | f x = g x } := sorry

/-- The image of `Aut F` in `∀ X, Aut (F.obj X)` is closed. -/
lemma autEmbedding_range_isClosed : IsClosed (Set.range (autEmbedding F)) := by
  rw [autEmbedding_range]
  refine isClosed_iInter
    (fun f ↦ isClosed_equalizer (Y := F.obj f.left → F.obj f.right) _ _ ?_ ?_)
  · sorry
  · sorry
```
Thanks! That's very nice and `isClosed_equalizer` actually already exists as `isClosed_eq`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Galois): topology of fundamental group
